content.detailedDescription:
My girlfriend and i were star gazing at a friend's house, when this group of lights caught our attention.  at first we thought it was a plane because all we saw at first was two white lights and a red in the center, but as it passed over us, we clearly saw it was not.  a black perfect equilateral triangle. it didn't have the saw tooth pattern on the back like the b-2, it wasn't diamond shaped like the f-117, just a perfect black triangle with three bright white lights on the bottom of each point, and one less bright, slightly larger red light in the center. it emitted a sound. though only slight, it was something of a metallic muffled hum.  also the way it moved was pretty disturbing.  it didn't swoop like what an aircraft usually does. it kind of shook. almost like balancing a magnet on top of another. it looked like whatever was keeping it up was not jet propulsion. as quickly as it passed it disappeared behind the tree line a mile off.
afterward i was excited, almost a little upset that i didn't get to meet these beings, if at all they were aliens, but a general feeling of uneasiness befell everyone. my reason is, i've never heard of a pleasant abduction by a triangular craft.
content.summary: Fist ufo fly directly above my friend's house, had to be an altitude less than 600 ft. this thing was huge, and quiet. i saw the complete silloutte.  perfect triangle.

content.detailedDescription:
I was looking up in the sky at the skydivers who were brining the game ball for a william and mary football game. at that time i noticed a bright star.  there were no other clouds, no other "stars" and a complete bluebird sky.  the star didn't move at all, so i knew it wasn't a plane or satellite.  it was very high in the sky as there were dark birds soaring in the sky(they were dark shadows, from the angle of the sun setting towards the west) and this light was much higher and further from viewing distance on the ground. 

i pointed this out to my friends at the tailgate and they saw it and couldn't determine what it was.  after about 1 min or so, this light vanished.  i then noticed another light, lower on the horizon (from the first star) but still very high in the sky.  this light appeared to have 3 distinct lights...Very close together, in the shape of a triangle.  it didn't move and appeared to raise the level of its illuminescence from very bright "star-like" to very low but still visible.  watched this for 2-5 minutes and nothing changed, no movement.  i then went about my business and the lights were gone when i next looked up...Within 30 minutes of the sighting.
content.summary: 3 bright lights (star-like) in shape of a triangle

content.detailedDescription:
I was on the bus early in the morning on the way to school, and it was a very clear day with no clouds in the sky, and so there were no strange shadows from the sun and clouds.

i was sat on the left side of the bus on the back seat next to the window and so i could see perfectly what was outside. the bus had started to climb a steep hill out of a valley, and my view was blocked by a tall hedge on the left side. when we reached the top of the hill the hedge ended and then there is an open dirt track, and then just as i was looking down this dirt track as i do every day, i glimpsed upward as i saw a small glint. 

again, it was a very hot and clear day and so i know that i wasn't just seeing a strange shadow of some kind, and i make this journey every day and so i know what is and what isn't out of the ordinary. 

once i had noticed the glint of the reflection of sunlight, i immediately looked up and saw what appeared to be a sphere that looked very metallic in appearance. i was amazed at it as it was not moving at all, and i knew that no technology of today is sophisticated enough to be as still as what this object was, so i straight away dismissed the fact that is was any kind of aircraft that i knew of, it was definitely not of this world as far as i know. when i looked at it i noticed that there were no ropes or anything that would be holding it still, so i also dismissed the fact that it was a weather balloon of some sort. it was just perfectly still in mid air- hovering. from what i could tell it must have been at least 80-100 feet up in the air above the dirt track. from where i was, it looked about the size of a wrecking ball, but i know that it wasn't a very small object. (in my personal opinion it could have been some sort of probe or reconnaissance object) 

i couldn't understand what or why it was there, and i know for a fact that the day previous to the event that it was not there at all. as the bus drove further away and into a nearby village, i continued to look at the object as i thought that it might vanish at some stage but it didn't. when the bus drove into the village i could no longer see it as there were houses and trees in the way. the bus continued through the village and we eventually came out of the village the same way we came in, and so i was expecting it to still be there, but it had now vanished. i looked around the area where it was and also the surrounding area to make sure that it hadn't simply moved to another place, but it had vanished and there was no further sighting of the object at all. i haven't ever been this close to an object that i am unfamiliar with, and i was very intrigued to find out what the object was. i am not a ufo skeptic at all, and i am very interested in this subject.  

i would like to thank you for reading this story, and i am intrigued to find out if there have been any further sightings of objects similar to this.
content.summary: I was on the bus on the way to school and witnessed a silver/metallic sphere that was inanimate.

content.detailedDescription: I previously reported a sighting which occurred on september 22, 2010, which commenced with a red light, however a similar event took place the following evening, which this report describes.  the important difference in this second sighting is the unusual effects on my camera and on the pictures taken of this second object.  on the evening of on september 23, 2010, my dog began acting as he did on the 22nd (extremely concerned to go out) so we went outside at about 7:45 pm. this time, i took my binoculars and camera. in the west, without binoculars, i saw a dim red or orange light just above the tree line which is a thousand feet away. i do not know the distance of the object from my position, but its size when viewed was about the size of a planet. i took 2 pictures (sony cyber-shot 14.1, auto-set), then it just disappeared. once again, as soon as the light vanished, the dog behaved normally, no longer stared toward where the object had been (an action he also took on the 22nd), and was content to go back inside and remain there.  at no other time has my dog acted in the manner that he did on these two nights.  the effects on my camera and on the 2 pictures i took once downloaded were most unusual.  from the camera playback, picture one seemed just black; picture two seemed to show only low clouds lit up by the moon. when scrolling through the pictures on the camera, several times when the second picture should have been displayed, the camera has a blue screen that says ���file error���, and each time the pictures were viewed through the camera, the dates on these two were off by one day for the pictures taken on the 22nd (camera says 21st) and the 23rd (camera says 22nd).  i downloaded the pictures immediately after taking them, and a very faint orange light could be seen on both pictures. when this first download was viewed the second time, the orange light had turned black; on the third viewing the object was dimmer, but still could be seen, but on the fourth viewing, the object was gone entirely. i then downloaded the pictures a second time, and only a black object could be seen on both pictures. when this second download was viewed a second time, the black object was dimmer but still could be seen. upon the third viewing, the object was gone entirely. in these two downloads, the black object was in the same location where the orange object previously had been.  the next day, i downloaded the pictures again, but no object could be seen on either picture. the background of these two pictures never varied in any download, only the color of the object and its subsequent disappearance.  these events have been disturbing to me because at no other time has my camera malfunctioned in any manner, and never has an image of anything altered after download in any way.
content.summary: Dim orange light seen, photos taken but camera and image failure

content.detailedDescription:
I was driving home from work early (i work night shift) so it was almost 2 am. i was in the middle of all the windmills near chalmers/wolcott exit going north on i-65.  i looked up in the sky and saw what i though was 2 stars very close to each other. but the one was moving at a slow but steady pace but blinking on and off kind of slowly as it was moving south east. it wasnt flashing lights like any kind of airplane, when it was off it completely disappeared until blinking on again. in the sky it appeared to me about the same size as a star but as i watched it i could tell that it was much closer.  i watched it as long as i could until it was behind my car and i didnt want to drive off the road. 
    i felt pretty excited because i this is now my 4th ufo sighting in the last 4 months. i have since really started researching the history of ufos and keeping an eye out for them, but only seem to them when i am not really looking. i know something is going on right under our noses and we all have the right to know what it is.
content.summary: Star-like object slowly binking on and off

content.altitude: Over 500 Feet (under cloudcover), Over 500 Feet (no cloudcover)
content.detailedDescription:
I was hanging out with the neighborhood kids in front of my driveway laying down listening to solar fields - air song(ambient space music) on full blast on my computer speakers i had set up outside just having a great day, relaxing and socializing when i caught a glimpse of an odd white dot in the sky silently ripping across the sky headed south at an incredible speed.

i had pointed it out the them, (they couldn't believe their eyes either) and amidst our confusion, it just disappeared out of plain sight...Needless to say we were a bit freaked out...I kept telling myself it was a piece of drifting cottonwood in the air, but the next sighting completely knocked that idea out of the picture...

about 10 minutes later we managed to calm down a little, the kids went back to playing around, i kept looking up and around laying down on my back, when i noticed another one flying south at i guess 3500-4000 miles an hour, and it disappeared behind the white haze in the air(it was a clear blue skied day with a wierd fuzzy white haze in the air, possibly the effect of aerosol chemtrail spraying)

this happened over and over again in 10, 15 and sometimes 20 minute intervals apart, one craft at a time, and at some points in between i caught "blinks?" of the same crafts zipping in and out of sight like they were exiting and reentering some kind of portal in the atmosphere...It happened so fast that i had to ask one of the kids if they saw it too and indeed they did,(some were still watching the sky with me) so that confirmed that it wasn't just me who witnessed it...It got so bad that i had to go and get my pellet gun to look through my scope to get a better look, and it helped me to not misidentify a regular aircraft from a ufo, and to my best effort, i couldnt spot one in time before they dissapeared(they did that quite a lot)


i had also taken note of the local regular aircrafts' cruising speed and altitude and they were nowhere near the speed/altitude of these said crafts...It almost dumbfounded me that i was witnessing such a phenomenon and i almost couldn't believe myself and what i was seeing, nonetheless i did see a ufo...And it was just about the most unsettling thing i have ever seen in my life, yet one of the most exiting and liberating things i have ever witnessed.
content.shape: Chevron,   Sphere,   Teardrop,   Triangle,   Other,   Unknown
content.summary: A sighting in kennedale with winesses of a white dot ufo

content.detailedDescription: I was at my home in mill creek (about 20 miles north of seattle) watching tv when my sister, who was in the backyard, asked me to come outside to look at something strange in the sky she could not identify.  i was curious so i came outside to have a look at what she was talking about.  when i was outside, she pointed at 2 (she said there had been 3) fairly bright orange objects in the sky.  i have never seen anything before that had the appearance of these lights and i'm not sure what they could have been.  the light they were emitting seemed very strange.  they were moving roughly in a north to south direction and appeared to be quite high up.  they seemed to be moving at about the speed of a jet airplane at first, but then one object slowed to a stop and hovered.  the second object kept going a bit further, then slowed down, changed direction and faded out of sight.  the first object remained visible for a bit longer, still hovering, then went dark as well.  by luck, the sky was clear that night and we had an unobstructed view of the objects.  we really aren't sure whether what we saw was military or otherwise, but it definitely was not a natural occurrence.
content.flightPath: Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: 3 moving objects in the night sky that resembled bright orange stars

content.detailedDescription:
Four of us went to visit white tank state park, by car, on the outskirts of phoenix, az, to take photos of cacti, the desert, with a nice background. 

i noticed a trail of whitish line in the sky, as we entered the park at around 5:20 pm, and i thought it was a military plane, producing a trail. we spent about an hour in the park taking photos, and as we were about to leave, i noticed that the whitish trail hadn't changed at all, and it was still there.

we couldn't explain what it could be, and i took some photos to have some expert identify it. i've enlarged one of the photos, and i'm enclosing it.

[name removed/cms/tg]
content.summary: Beam of light, stationary, with a spherical light leading it.

content.detailedDescription: I was standing on the deck, smoking a cigarette outside of my parents home in orion, mi around midnight on october third. i was looking into the night sky, and noticed that a lot of dogs in the surrounding suburb were barking more than they usually do. i was watching some interesting cloud formations blow by when i saw a blue streak cross the sky above. i thought at first that it might have been a comet, or a shooting star, but quickly realized that it was far too low to the ground, and seemed to be falling. as it got lower, i noticed that it looked like it was on fire, the actual object looked round and seemed to be engulfed in bright blue flames, and was followed by a cooler, orange trail. the object was quite large, perhaps the size of a quarter if you held it out in your hand against the horizon. it watched the object as zipped by and descended lower to the horizon. i was expecting it to collide to the earth, but before it reached the edge of my viewable horizon, it seemed to blink a couple of times before it disappeared entirely. the entire sighting was fairly short, perhaps only two seconds or maybe even less. when it was over, i stood watching the sky in shock for around five minutes. i was so distracted by what had happened that i noticed that my cigarette had gone out while stared i dumbly at the horizon. i also noted that after the object had vanished, more dogs around the neighborhood started barking. eventually i got too cold to keep looking at the sky, so went in side, grabbed my computer to search for any astronomical events over the michigan sky for the night, and found nothing that would account for i had just seen. i am still unsure of what i saw, and am pretty hesitant to say it was an extra-terrestrial craft, but it was certainly a ufo. i am hoping that someone who reads this might be able to explain what i saw, or at least quench my curiosity.
content.summary: Large burning object low in the sky, falling.

content.detailedDescription: I left my house in northern rome, ga to go get dinner. heading south on mlk blvd as i approached the hill at the coosa valley fair grounds (no fair in town they were completely empty) i noticed a light bright light bigger than the size of a streetlight directly above the hill as i got closer thinking it was just a star it streaked off for one second and disappeared. thinking i was just seeing a shooting star i headed on to get dinner. amazed and still looking to the sky i noticed that there were no other stars shining through. i shrugged it off and headed to my business then as i was approaching my home on old calhoun rd. right past maxway right before getting to brinkley's auto i saw it again. the same exact light doing the same exact thing only heading in the opposite direction north this time. each time i seen the light it only lasted for a few seconds but both scared the blank out of me.
content.summary: Street light sized light on horizon in 2 area's of town with in 15 min's of each other.

content.detailedDescription:
I was standing on a oilfield float haveing pipe loaded on it and i looked up and seen a bright round star like object high in the sky it was perfectly clear sky at the time,it lasted for about 20 seconds and then diaperred into thin air,shortly after i saw a blavk fighter jet flying over a few miles from whare i seen the object then today j saw 2 warthoggs flying around this is not normal for around here. 
it might be nothing but it was like nothing i have ever saw before,and for it to just vanish was strange.
content.summary: Saw a bright star like object high in the perfectly clear sky  and  it  just  vanished into thin air

content.detailedDescription: The object appeared bright and at high altitude.It appeared to be on fire.Real bright lighting appeared to be a flame of sorts.The craft appeared to be under control and not spirialing down.It was on a east to west direction.The upper portion appeared to be larger roundish and the bottom (red part)appeared to be square.I watched this craft till it went over the horizion and was gone.It appeared the track was snaking alittle .From the left to the right somewhat.The speed from here looked slow.But at that altitude it must have been going very fast.I previously was a mufon member and private pilot with cival air patrol.I was unable to complete my membership due to a accident that left me disabled.So i know a ufo when i see one.
content.summary: 2 peice (attached)upper appeared green or flaming lower red and square.

content.detailedDescription: I was taking photos of a real estate listing in ellis county near waxahachie on fm 66.  i did not see this object, nor hear it, or realize anything actually until one day later, today, this morning (oct 2nd 2010) when i was reviewing the photos and choosing the ones i want for the listing.  i saw this object, then zoomed in, and no doubt it has a disk shape.  it's in only one photo, but the photos taken directly before it in the same area do not show it.  i have a nikon coolpix p80 camera which took the photo, and the flash was off, so time in between photos was short, maybe 5-7 seconds or so.  the photos directly afterwards are of the back of the home, showing i was completely unaware of what was just photographed.  the photo was taken at 12:16pm cst on the right side of the home facing the back yard to the left of the home.  the barn in the picture is the neighbors barn and not on this property.  i still have the original photo on the memory stick.  the first photo is the image photo in the top left corner.  the next 2 photos are the ones that directly proceeded this photo showing the same area and taken within seconds of this one. i have saved the photo on multiple computers as to not lose it, still have it on the memory stick, and emailed to myself and family.
content.summary: Was taking photos for a real estate listing and captured a disk object in one of the shots

content.altitude: Over 500 Feet (under cloudcover), Over 500 Feet (no cloudcover)
content.detailedDescription:
On 30 september 2010, i observed an interesting celestial phenomenon, the like of which i had never seen before.  i will describe this event so it becomes part of the historical record of such events which occur and might be explained if other people also observed it or know of events or occurrences which can identify or explain it.

my home is located in the town burlington, wi some on bushnell road.  my lot is about 3 acres in size and has treed and open areas, along with my house and three other outbuildings.  from many places of my lot, i have excellent visibility of the sky in all directions.  i can easily get to all of my lot from any of my structures in just a few seconds.

i returned home from work approximately 6:30 ��� 6:45 pm and entered my detached garage with my automobile.  immediately, after entry, i let 2 of my dogs out of their kennels to get their evening run and spend time with them.  after about 15 minutes i returned them to their kennels in the garage and gathered items from my automobile and garage to bring them into my house.  i entered my house through the attached garage service door and put my items down on the stair landing in the garage.  i then let out my pup from his kennel in the attached garage to have his run as well.  again after abut 10 ��� 15 minutes, i returned him to his kennel and then i brought my things into the house.

knowing i had to look for something in my detached garage, i returned to it and quickly found what i needed and set it aside to use later.  it was approximately 7:00 ��� 7:15 pm as near as i can estimate since i did not look at my wristwatch at that time.  when i left the service door in my detached garage i happened to look up in the western sky.  i observed a red and white flashing light and figured i had seen an airplane and this was through the trees.  however. i did not see it emerge from the trees and so i kept watching the sky above the tree as i was walking to my house.  suddenly, i saw the same light phenomenon as i reached a point when i could see a large expanse of the western sky.  

this flashing light group appeared to have red and white flashing lights some short distance apart on both sides of what i will describe as a horizontal access.  it also had white flashing lights at either end of a vertical access.  my cartoon of this description is attached.  at first i thought this was simply an airplane heading approximately nw according to my position of observation.  suddenly, this thing stopped moving and seemed to hold its position in the sky.  i continued walking westward and cleared any trees and other high obstructions to my view of the westward sky.  i was in my neighbor's yard at this time.

this thing made horizontal tracks in the sky in each horizontal direction.  i will designate this as right and left directional movement.  it moved at least 10 of its lateral width's to the right, back to its original position and then at least 10 of its lateral widths to the left and then back to its original position.  it could move quickly ~ 1 second for the complete right or left directions or very slowly ~ 10 seconds for the same movement.  it could also do this vertically, which i would designate in the up and down directions.  i watched this for about 15 minutes.  then this thing seemed to fly off in a nw direction and stop again.  i watched it do the same maneuvers and started scanning the skies to the north, west and south which were visible from my position.

to my surprise, i saw several of these objects in the sky!  they were all doing similar maneuvers and as i counted them, i was sure i counted approximately 8 to 10 of these things.  the were positioned from the southeast to the northwest from what i was able to discern.  all of them were able to make the same movements as i previously described.

i was moderately excited to have observed these things and i went inside my home about 8:15 pm to rest and recall what i had seen.  as i said, i have no idea what these things are and i first thought maybe the military has a new flying object and was testing here in wisconsin.  also, could these things just have been air traffic in some kind of holding pattern for chicago ��� o'hare or milwaukee ��� mitchell airports.  i heard no sounds coming from these things as well but i will also state, these were quite high up in the sky and maybe inaudible to me.  i cannot think of any other information to put into this short report.  below is a stylized layout of the flashing lights i saw on that night.  

i made sketch of what i saw in the sky, which are the flashing light positions.  the crossed lines are for my reference to draw the ���thing��� to some degree of scale as i can remember.  if there is an explanation, please let me know what it is.  thank you.
content.flightPath: Stationary,Hovering then path,Straight-line path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Red and white flashing lights moving in the sky

content.detailedDescription: My soninlaw was driving us home from my daughter who lives in auburn, ga. we we going on 85, i looked out of the window, and looked to my right, and up. i saw a triangle, with red flashing lights on top and bottom. we were moving avout 60 ,and it was so close i could almost reach out. no one else saw it. i  kept quiet until today. i am not sure if anyone else saw it. it was about 9:45. i didn't really feel anything.
content.summary: Coming home from auburn ga.To my right of the car i looked out saw a triangle with red flashing lights on top and bottom.

content.detailedDescription:
These four continuous photos were captured on 2 oct 2010, 4: 47: 48 pm, with a shutter speed of 1/1000 of a second. you may see how the ufo object travels and emitted light in one second. relate ufo photos: *link moved to additional evidence section below--cms/sg.  

this case is one of my long term  ufo & alien���s  visitation, more details from: **link moved to additional evidence section below--cms/sg.
content.summary: Ufo object emitted light

content.detailedDescription:
i'm not quite sure if it was july 17th exactly.. but it was definitely in july 2010.. honestly, i have seen three definite ufos this year alone, i managed to catch the other two on video - but this one was more amazing than those two, in the way that this one was lower; not just lights. i could see the shape, colour, flight patterns, and even the detail on the metallic surface. it had a 'hatch' on the bottom - and im only calling it a hatch because i can think of no other word for it.. that place where the aliens walk out on a ramp from in the movies, and also where the 'abduction ray' comes from.. around that, were three lights, and three lines, as if seperating the craft into three seperate sections - or maybe just for design. 

i was sleeping in the attic which had been converted into a bedroom, in my cousins house. both of us have trouble sleeping so i was looking out the skylight window when this event occured. it was around 4:30am (gmt)and i was staring at this object the whole time while it hovered slowly accross the night sky.

as soon as this ufo came into view, i thought to myself "now there's a classic examply of a flying saucer - just like the typical interpretation"

i had a camera phone right beside me, but i didnt want to miss the opportunity to watch this ufo for as long as i could. when i say "ufo" i do not mean "unidentified flying object" - i mean an alien spaceship, because i only use the term 'ufo' when i know thats exactly what it is.

i was happy to see it so clearly, in such detail.
i have always believed in aliens, and that they are here on earth. recording this on my phone - where videos could not be faked, would've proved it to everybody who got to see it.. i wish i had recorded a video of this ufo passing above me, but i was too pre-occupied with watching it to even think about picking up my phone.

my cousin said "what did you see?" when he saw me stare.. i replied "oh.. just a ufo.." as if it was nothing to me, but it was.. i only replied in such a way because i had seen several ufos before, and already known of their presence.

i will report the other ufos with video foorage, and the exact time and date. i just wanted to start with this one.
content.summary: Metallic, low flying, slow moving, rotating object with three white lights on the bottom hovered overhead

content.detailedDescription:
On friday night, october 1st, 2010, i was at one of my favorite dark sky areas i go to for meteor showers and general star gazing.

at about 10:45 i noticed what looked like a star in the north western sky at about 15 - 20 degrees above the horizon.  it seemed to be about a magnitude 2 in brightness.  the reason this caught my attention is because i am very familiar with the night sky and this "star" didn't seem to belong in that part of the sky.

i immediately looked at it through my binoculars but it simple appeared to be a star.  it was not moving and it was quickly changing colors just as a star does when it is low in the sky.

i still felt that this object should not be in the position it was if it was a star so every couple of minutes i would check it out again through the binoculars to see if its position had changed.  every time i checked it was in the same position.  i did this for about 15 minutes at which point i knew if it was a star i should have been able to tell that it had dropped a few degrees lower towards the horizon due to the movement of the earth.  it had not moved at all.

it was by this time, being interested in and believing that there are objects in the sky that are unexplainable, i began thinking to myself, "if you're not going to move down, move up.  then i will know you're not a star."
still no movement was noticed.

after about 15 minutes of noticing this object, i looked at it again and it finally looked like it had moved.  i once again looked at it through the binoculars and it was finally moving in an easterly direction.  it still looked exactly like a star until it had moved far enough to be approximately nnw of me. i could then start seeing that there were 3 distinct light on this object. there were two orange lights that stayed lit continuously and one red light in the middle that pulsated.  i did not see a green light or a white strobe light like you would expect to see on an airplane.

i followed the object using my binoculars all the way across the sky from west to east until it got in the north eastern sky until it was close to the position in the sky very close to the constellation auriga.  at this time it was like someone just turned out the lights.  it was if there was nothing ever there.

i then began checking out the rest of the sky again.  i noticed something to the north again traveling west to east but after looking at it through the binoculars it appeared to have the lighting of a traditional aircraft.

i then looked back to the ne where the unidentified object had disappeared and didn't see anything.  at the same time a relatively bright orange light was seen moving north to south at about the same elevation in the sky as the original object that i was tracking. i looked at it through the binoculars and appeared almost identical to the original object but the separation in the three lights was not as noticeable.  i have no idea if this was the same object but considering the timing and the location in the sky i would assume it was.

the next night i went to this same spot wanting to watch an airplane traveling near the same path as the object i had seen the night before thinking that a plane my appear also as a star like object from a distance near the north western horizon.  i was fortunate enough to see one close to the same location.  i was able to distinguish it as looking like an airplane until it was very close to the horizon.  even then it looked nothing like the object i saw when i first noticed it.
content.summary: Starlike object begins moving after 15 minutes of hovering.  after it got closer i could see that the object had multiple lights.

content.detailedDescription:
I was driving eastward towards concord on 24 freeway this past thursday, 10/1/10 about 12:55a.M.   the driver in front of me started to drive out of his lane.  i thought he was drunk, so widely went around him. i looked at him while passing and he was turning his head looking to the right/ahead of us.   i then noticed what he was looking at:  lights in the sky about 1- 2 o'clock to our right and far ahead. there were two red lights diagonal to each other on the left side and a whitish-greenish light to the right.  the white/green one was not in alignment with the red ones, but had a similarness that it appeared to be associated with the red ones.  i remember recalling that they were in the distance, yet pretty far apart so how could they be "one plane?"   but then i thought that due to the colors (red and greenish) it must be a plane.  but these lights were far in the distance (15 miles??) and pretty far apart,  yet stayed in the same place for about the one minute i could see them while trying to drive.   i wanted to stop but i was on the freeway near the merge with 680, was tired,  and didn't want to risk getting hit from behind should someone else not be paying attention to the road while looking at these lights.      

then i thought they might have been lights for a concert in the hills or something but realized it was about 1 o'clock a.M.  i believe there is a curfew.   also i thought their location was higher than any hills around the area.    i saw a plane a minute or two later to the left of me over martinez and it clearly had lights that were closer together, even though the plane was closer to me that the lights had been.  

i saw a 747 type plane flying over my house today at a pretty low altitude and guestimated that if these lights were located on an object in the sky,  it must have been huge.

since i did not see it for a long time, so i may be totally mistaken.  but i believe the lights were in the sky,  they were in the distance,  and they did not look like something familiar to me.
content.summary: Red and white lights in distance

content.detailedDescription:
Before submitting this event i checked to see if anyone else reported it, and i beleive it is the same event as reported from arizona on the same day.

i was looking up at the sky. in my city you can hardly see the stars, only the brightest of them can be seen. the sky was cloudless in the area i was looking.

i noticed a point light appear and slowly move, seemingly in a northerly direction, but as it slowly moved it got brighter. it appeared brighter than the lights on planes so it got quite bright. after about 20 seconds it started to dim, but it seemed to me at the time it started to dim it changed direction slightly and speed, and in about 10 seconds it was gone. 

it definately was not a sat, possibly a meteor, but the way it moved and looked seems odd to be a meteor, unless the meteor was coming straight down almost directly towards my position.

i have provided a few sketches.

sketch a represents my viewing of the sky looking towards north at about 65 degree angle.

sketch b is the way i interpretted it. this does not necessarily mean this is how it moved, but only how it was perceived to move. the sketch shows the earth, and a location where i would be standing. if it was an object, this is how it would be perceived. it seemed to go from outer space, into the atmosphere, and back out again. i hope this helps to related how i perceived it.

as a final note, i still think it may have been a meteor, although i have never seen one like that. usually they shoot quickly across the sky. but i figured i would file the report anyways in case what i describe could not be a meteor.
content.summary: Slow moving bright star like object

content.detailedDescription: I went outside around 2am for a cigarette before going to bed. the sky was perfectly clear no clouds, i was outside about 3-4 minutes when i looked to the east and saw a disc shaped object no higher than 10-15 stories up coming from east heading west. it was lit up with amber or orange lights in a circular pattern. as soon as this object came off the ocean and over land its lights went out, i could still see it, it was like a shadow but still visable. as it passed directly over head it made no sound at all and headed west i realized there were 2 more, seemed like they were waiting for it with no lights and (dancing)around. the object moved very slowly. as soon as it met up with the others they all moved west and out of sight. i know what i saw and it was real.Whatever it was.
content.summary: Round amber lights silent

content.detailedDescription: I am only doing this because i cannot fathom why no one else has.  huge, black, isosceles triangle with the nose tipped up a bit was moving a snails pace above a cloud during rush hour traffic.  it was coming from the west moving east, casting a shadow over the cloud, occasionally peeking out.  this object was literally blocking out the sun.  rays of sunshine were highlighting the edges of the craft, it was so big i cannot imagine i was the only person to have noticed it, i went into the bank... came out it had only moved a little but was much less visible. there were also 3 helicopters moving in and out of the cloud.
content.summary: Huge, black  triangle moving very slowly from west to east in broad daylight.

content.detailedDescription:
Driving to st. louis from des peres, traveling south at i-270 at kirkwood i noticed an incongruent triangle of red lights at about 15 degrees off the horizon traveling west to east, my right to left. the lights were fixed and appeared to be on a craft like a helicopter but didn't have faa helicopter navigation light colors nor blinking, all the lights faded and brightened in unison about once a second. it seemed like it could have been a large helicopter traveling adjacent to i-44, an east/west highway that intersected with i-270 about a mile or two from where i was when i first noticed it entering my field of vision. as i traveled and exited on to i-44 east, the object appeared to move in a southeast direction as i was getting closer to it. it was about the "size" of a dime at the closest i then saw it. i was tempted to stay on i-270 to possibly catch up to it as i was getting closer to it, but i continued on home - i don't go chasing ufos or possible ufos. after merging onto i-44 i started to see if i could yet see it in the distance by glancing to my right while driving. i didn't see anything for about a mile, there also being some small hills at that side of the highway that blocked a closer perspective. after clearing the last of these small hills there was suddenly, fairly close, the same incongruently shaped triangle of lights, but now all white and not blinking but keeping a constant brightness and much closer. i traveling east, the craft was at a 45 degree angle to my right just above the windshield while i was driving, so i could now only glance up to it once in a while. while i glanced up at it, it quickly had two of its lights flare up to a brighter white while the "back" white light went out. every time i got a chance to glance up to it while it was slowly passing in front of me about 45 degrees above me now, it was about the "size" of a dollar coin. it's lighting configuration had dimmed but stayed all white but also was slightly changing each time, additional lights coming into view when i would look up. by the time it passed at about 45 degrees to my left, about 15 degrees off the horizon, it seemed i could see a very black indefinite triangular structure that had four evenly spaced white lights on what from my perspective was its back with its point facing in the direction it was traveling away from me. there was additional lighting along a possible bottom and edges, those not so symmetrical as the four "back" lights. the craft appeared to be moving slower than a plane could. i could not tell if there was sound from it for the interstate highway noise.

two of the previous three nights i also saw lights that didn't appear to be on conventional craft while i was driving, each not far from a point i saw tonight's craft, but i could not view them long enough to figure out what it was or wasn't. so, i'm making this report as tonight's craft did not appear it could have been conventional by its lighting color and configuration changes. it's weird to me that 3 of the past 4 nights i've seen strange lights as i was traveling somewhere along the same route each night between my home in st. louis and a place in des peres. last year i had several mufon reported sightings and pictures of day and night craft, clearly unconventional. this year i've had a few clear unconventional night sightings, but a lot of sightings that have kept me wondering what it was i saw, and i'm wondering what's up with that :)
content.summary: Triangle of lights change color and configuration

content.detailedDescription:
A group of us were coming back from an scca car race at sears point, ca.  the group was divided into two vehicles.  the lead vehicle was a pick up truck which was towing the formula ford race car on an open trailer.  in its cab were three of us; all friends of about the same age..Approximately 22 to 25 years of age.  the railing vehicle was a late model bmw sedan in which there were five occupants.  we were headed south on highway 5, returning home after a long weekend of racing.

there was very little traffic on the highway (it was lightly travelled at the time) and we were probably traveling in excess of 60 miles per hour as the old truck just didn't have much torque; the motor was tired.  approximately 70 or so miles south of the junction of the ..... and the 5 we noticed far in the distance the presence of several 5 or 6 oval shaped, intense blue lights moving erratically from east to west across the highway.  the lights moved in random directions, up and down and sideways, orbiting each other at times but with no specific discernible purpose or direct linkage.  at first site we remarked that it had to be a police helicopter.  an interesting observation is that although two of us had flight experience and knew aviation well, we nevertheless described these lights as belonging to a helicopter.....In reality, no helicopter would demonstrate this peculiar behavior.  it was almost as though at not being able to describe what the lights were, we unanimously decided that they were a helicopter.  what follows is a glimpse into just how cognizant the human animal is regarding the unearthly aspect of this phenomenon.  this ascribing of an explanation is the beginning of the panic.

the lights slowly crossed the highway from east to west until they were off the road to our right, (west of highway 5).  they stopped their east-west movement and waited until our vehicles were abeam of their position.  how far they were from us is difficult to estimate as the night was pitch black and there were no reference points visible.  you could just barely make out the outlines of the rolling barren hills that wind their way to the west of the highway, behind the light sources.  they continued to orbit and move in random directions.  at once we were gripped with a sudden and inescapable realization that what we were witnessing was not from our planet.  it was intuitively obvious that these lights were under some form of control and their behavior was not of this world.  all three of us in the cabin of the truck began to scream and to urge the driver to speed up.  we didn't know that the same form of hysteria had possessed the occupants of the car behind ours.  the best recollection i have of the physical manifestations of these objects/lights was that they behaved as luminous objects that possessed a brilliantly, almost incandescently lighted exterior envelope.  it is as though the skin of the object was intensely luminous, giving out an incandescent blueish light, very similar to the light emitted by an electric arch tig or mig welder; that kind of intensity and localized focus. the color was constant across the oval; it did not differ in shade.  the edges of the light were not sharply demarcated but "fuzzy".  

the objects/lights followed us for a few minutes, staying abeam of our vehicles but maintaining their random pseudo-orbital movements.  i can vividly remember the sheer horror of the experience and the panic inside that truck cab.  we were smart kids who knew about flight; this was no ordinary man-made machine.  this was from out of this world and we just knew we had to run away.  almost a limbic response to the stimulus.  odd.  i remember that for a brief period of time the objects came marginally closer to our vehicles (closing the distance by half or so) and they then suddenly separated and flew in widely different directions westward and at low altitude; almost in a terrain following mode.  in a few seconds they had disappeared.

the crush of the last few minutes of sheer horror slowly subsided and we began to slowly disengage (best word to describe the feeling) from the event.  we talked about it in questioning tones for a few minutes and then silence until the next gas stop.  by the time we were half way home we had stopped talking about the incident.  when we arrived in los angeles all of us spoke maybe a few words about the incident in the driveway and that was it.  for the past thirty-five years we have never touched the subject.  ever.  all of us except for the driver of the trailing vehicle who passed away some time after the incident, have remained in constant touch and we see each other regularly.  we have been the best of friends for all of these years.

what is extremely interesting is that i have wanted to broach the subject with my circle of friends on multiple occasions and something holds me back.  i don't know what it is but it is a powerful subconscious force at work.

the events i have just listed occurred exactly as i have described them.  i have done this to the best of my recollection and abilities.  none of this has been dramatized or embellished.  the events remains deeply etched in my memory.
content.flightPath: Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Blueish  light.  intense and radiant

content.detailedDescription: My girlfriend and i were going out for a bite to eat and as we were going down the hill we saw a large black or very dark object moving fairly quickly in front of us going across town. at first i said, "is that a balloon?" but very quickly knew that it wasn't and immediately said, "that's no balloon!!". this very dark or black object moved northward across the sky towards the house but as i slowed to take a look at it closer, it went behind the trees but my friend could see it still. she exclaimed, "it's getting smaller" and all of a sudden it took a quick left turn towards the west/northwest and just disappeared out into the sky. this took place at 6:49pm so it was still light so we saw the object very clearly. we were very excited and she was a bit numbed at first before she could say anything. i'm so used to seeing them now and actually i had multiple sightings last night but i will report separately.
content.summary: Large black round object moving at a fast clip moving northward took left turn shrank and disappeared

content.detailedDescription: I was haveing a cigarette on my front porch, with my wife. i am acustomed to seeing planes and helicopters in the night sky, i looked up, and saw a red or orange glowing light that looked odd as it seemed larger and brighter than ones i see marking planes and helicopters. it resembled meteors i have seen in it's shape and color, but seemed larger and was moveing quite slow, a bit slower than most of the airtraffic i usualy see. i pointed it out to my wife, and i jokeingly said " check out this ufo ". my wife laughed and said that it was just a plane, then she noticed that it didn't apear to have any of the small, flashing lights one expects on a plane. she suggested the possibility of a meteor, but we both thought it moved much too slow, and didn't have a tail like a "shooting star" it began to glow brighter and my wife got excited and opened the door to the living room and shouted for our son to come look. after a moment, my our son appeared just as the light seemed to dim and go out. we all talked for a moment about how "cool" it was to have seen it and what it could have been, when the light seemed to come back on. it was very dim at first, then it returned to it's origanal brightness. it continued to travel at the same speed and in the same direction it had previously. it appeared to be in the sky to the south or southeast of our home. it moved from west to east and appeared to be traveling in a straight line, approximately level. i couldn't say how large it was or how far away it might have been. it looked like it was somewhere over gwinnett, but may have been further south. after a moment it became obscured by trees and left our view. the entire sighting lasted for about a minute and a half, it was witnessed by myself, my wife and my son. the object didn't appear like a plane or helicopter or anything common, it was similiar to a meteor in some ways but it seemed to fly very slowly and it appeared to maintain a level course, it didn't seem to be falling. i have seen the international space station cross over at night before, and it wasn't that either. it appeared to move slower and to be lower in altitude. i surmise there is a mundane explanation for it, i just don't know what it might be. it was an "object", it was "flying" and i don't know what was.  i did a google search to see if anyone else might have reported anything, which is how i came upon your websight. i feel that this sighting probably has a mundane explanation, and i hope you would be kind enough to share it with me if possible.
content.summary: A red/orange ball of light travelling slowly. it dimmed,went out, then lit back up

content.detailedDescription: I was camping out in the blue mountains west of sydney n.S.W with my two brothers. we were lying in our sleeping bags looking up at the stars , when i noticed something strange. very high up in the sky , looking like one of the stars was a red glowing circular object . at first it was stationary , but then all of a sudden it took off across the sky at an unbelievable speed and just stopped instantly . at first i said nothing to my brothers just incase i was imagining things , but the object just kept zipping around the sky so i pointed out what i was witnessing . first jeff noticed then anthony , we could not believe what we were seeing with our eyes . this red light was moving so fast that it was , at times hard to keep up with it. within 5 mins of watching. another two glowing objects , one glowing green and one glowing a kind of yellow appeared out of nowhere and began to dart around the sky around the first red light . the entire event lasted up to 20 mins , but the last two lights were only visible for the last 5 minutes or so . the strange thing was that they seemed to be trying to chase or scare away the red light and it worked because all 3 lights just simply took off at a crazy speed and were all instantly gone , just like that . to this day whenever we all catch up , that event always comes up in conversation and still amazes and confuses us to this day . how could anything travel that fast , come to a complete stop with no inertia at all , then take off at a completely different angle at a phenomenal speed without being held to the laws of our physics ?
content.summary: 3 glowing coloured star like objects

content.detailedDescription:
In january of 1967,about 50 of us were living off campus at the "tam-o-shanter" motel about 100 yards west of  southampton college on montauk highway (old rte 27).It was the middle of january but the weather was mild and the temperature was about 60 degrees. the atmosphere was damp and misty and the cloud cover most have been at 200 feet and very dense with some small gaps.We were playing touch football in the parking area in front of the motel when one of the guys said something like"holy crap" stopped dead in place and stared at the sky.We all stopped and looked up to see what was going on.Above us at about 200 ft. was a large(100 yds.?) moving through the clouds from west to east parallel to the highway. there was no sound whatsoever. it seemed to be a steel gray color with large circular figures around the perimeter. we were all stunned and no-one said a word except one guy who said that he was going to call the suffolk county air force base. he ran over to the phone booth and the rest of us just stood there watching, still not saying a word. the whole thing must only have lasted for 2 or 3 minutes. the object continued to move off east through the clouds at a pace that, if i wanted to keep up with it, all i would have to do was hit a fast trot.
the next morning, two officers from the air force showed up when most of us were in class and asked some questions and left. they never came back and i was never interviewed.
to the best of my knowledge, none of us ever discussed the incident and this is the first time that i have ever told anybody about this. one thing though; when it was over we all just walked away as if we were numb.
content.summary: Huge object moving at a dog trot pace through very low cloud cover

content.detailedDescription: we were driving home and my sister pointed out somthing flying low over the trees lining the highway. i leaned over to the window and noticed three red lights in a triangular pattern, with two blinking red lights, one on each side of the triangle in line with the others, and one larger red light in the center of the triangle. then i saw a light the color of a normal street light, golden in shade emitted like a slow torch from the rear or opposite the tip of the triangle for a brief moment possibly 1-2 secs then went away i only saw this light once . we were driving east bound on i-90 and had past the burk air port (for quite a while) approaching euclid. we couldnt tell if it was moving really slowly or hovering because we eventually past it, traveling at highway speeds. it was not a helicopter we saw a chopper later on and it looked nothing like it. once we past it we debated for a minute and eventually decided to turn around but couldnt see it on the way back. (dad was driving and never saw it, he was either to close to the trees having been in the drivers seat or too focused on driving.) my sister said some of the side was illuminated and appeared to be rounded in shape,  but i did not see any shape and only saw lights.
content.summary: Driving down highway see red lights over trees

content.detailedDescription:
After having seen an unidentifiable light in june, i have renewed energy for one of my hobbies that i have enjoyed since childhood. 
   it was 7:14 pm. the sun had barely set and only about 3 or 4 of the few stars we can see from here were barely visible. jupiter was also visable.  i was sitting out back chatting with my daughter before her bedtime. we were looking at jupiter with the binoculars to see how many of the 4 visible moons we could see. there was patchy cloud cover.  i saw a light in the south and thought it odd. there is not normaly a star in that area of the sky at that time in the evening. the light was moving slowly.  i then thought maybe it was a satalite due to the slow speed. i looked at it with my binoculars because i have never seen a satalite at 50 or 60 degrees from zenith. i looked for additional directional lights to determine if it was a plane. as it grew brighter, i began to suspect that it was an oncoming plane but it had only one non-blinking light.  i was adjusting my focus to confirm that it was one non-blinking light and was about to call to my husband to look at it too. i bumped my binoculars while refocusing and then it was gone. just poof, gone.  it had been slow moving in a northerly direction.  as it grew brighter it became a little bit teardrop shape. the best way i can describe the brightness is like a fireball meteor without any train. i have never seen a shooting star that had not trail behind it and this moved much slower than any meteor i have seen. it seemed like it was coming into the atmosphere. it did not go behind a cloud. the light occured in a patch of clear sky. i also noticed a lot of air trafic at the time. if it had been a plane or helicopter i should of been able to easily see additional lights as, i could see several lights on a plane a little higher and further south of the strange light. 
   i'd like to know if this is a type of meteor or possible space rubble from satallites or another known object coming into our atmosphere or if this is another unknown object. sorry for any poor spelling. i do not have a very good spell checker.
content.summary: Star moving slow, became increasingly brighter then just vanished.
